result.execSummary:
The defendant Jeremy K. Oxberger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
With huber and 75 days credit.  Costs have been paid from the cash bond that was posted.  Costs balance in this case is $0.
Concurrent with: 14CM84

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jeremy K. Oxberger

defendant.name: Oxberger, Jeremy K.
defendant.address: 28425 County Highway F, Blue River, WI 53518

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: RCSD - Disposition of Warrant or Commitment (Time Served)

Defendant Jeremy K. Oxberger in court, in custody, with attorney Mark Walter Frank. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Several cases called together:  15CM191, 14CM84, 16CF32, 16TR182, and 16TR181.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have reached an agreement for disposition whereby 16CF32, 16TR181 and 16TR182 will be dismissed and read in.  Def to plead to the single count in 15CM181 for 9 months jail with 75 days credit, concurrent with 14CM84/revocation case.  In 14CM84, parties ask for 4 months jail and civil judgment on costs remaining.  Def pleads no contest to 15CM181.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.

15CM191 - sentence:  9 months jail with huber and 75 days credit.  Costs, 60 dtp, due to Clerk of Court.

14CM84 - sentence: 4 months jail, concurrent.  Costs to be converted to civil judgment.

16CF32 dismissed/read-in as are the TR cases.
Court changed the date/time of the upcoming status as def will need to be transported.

Defendant Jeremy K. Oxberger in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Matter adj. to 3/2 as counsel have presented plea agreement that Court states it is not likely to accept; Court has directed parties to go back and renogiate.  Offer indicated today was for "costs only."  Status conference scheduled for March 2, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Jeremy K. Oxberger in court with attorney Mark Walter Frank. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  ADA states that this is DA Harper's case; ADA has extended an offer but def doesn't want to accept the offer; def wants to wait until DA Harper is back.  Status conference scheduled for January 13, 2016 at 03:30 pm.

Attorney Mark W. Frank appeared by phone means for Defendant Jeremy K. Oxberger.  Defendant Jeremy K. Oxberger in court. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin. Def stands mute to charges, requests further scheduling. Court directs clerk to enter NG pleas.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 09:00 am.
